intro: Exocarpos gaudichaudii, commonly known as the red-fruited hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, hibiscus-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, round, red berries that are edible and often used in traditional cuisines. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branching. Exocarpos gaudichaudii thrives in humid environments and is often found in coastal or wetland areas.
